item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Aquaretto
item.comment: Excellent, quick game that is easy to teach and because of its theme female friends were willing to play and enjoyed it. Has a good amount of played interaction and spite thy neighbour aspects

item.name: Brian Boru: High King of Ireland
Carcassonne
item.comment: First game I owned, still play occasionally, solid game with 2, good mix of luck vs stategy although some games can be frustrating if you keep getting roads

item.name: Disney Villainous: The Worst Takes it All
Dixit
item.comment:
With doubt my favourite party game, everyone who I play it with always asks me about it at a later date saying they've been thinking about it since and when can we play it again?
A great interactive fun game with excellent expansions and replayability

item.name: First Class: All Aboard the Orient Express!
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
The King Is Dead: Second Edition
Lost Cities
item.comment: Quick not very intense card game with some agonising decisions to be made one of my most played (just use the cards from the board game)

item.name: Lost Cities: The Board Game
item.comment: Doesn't hold the same speed or intensity of decisions as the card game but good game none the less

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Recurring Nightmares: Figure and Tile Collection
Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Streets of Arkham: Expansion
Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Suppressed Memories: Figure and Tile Collection
Merv: The Heart of the Silk Road
Rajas of the Ganges: Goodie Box 1
Rajas of the Ganges: The Dice Charmers
Ticket to Ride Map Collection 1: Asia + Legendary Asia
Ticket to Ride Map Collection 3: The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: Great colourful components and board, attractive to non gamers with easy rules and I really like the open scoring around the edge of the track with the concealed points at the end. The perfect gateway game
